allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add ellipse support, trim placement improvements, and UI reorganization

Major Features:
- Ellipse/circular trim support with non-uniform scaling
- Unrestricted trim placement option (allows placement outside 0-1 UV space)
- Shift+proportional scaling for maintaining aspect ratios
- Enhanced snapping system with UV boundary snapping
- UI improvements: reorganized trim buttons and auto-expand/collapse

Ellipse Implementation:
- Convert circles to ellipses with separate radius_x and radius_y
- Square transform gizmo for consistent UX across all trim shapes
- Ellipse-aware SVG import/export (circle vs ellipse tags)
- Fix circle rendering gap (pie with missing piece issue)

Transform Enhancements:
- Add Shift key support for proportional scaling in corner/edge operators
- Implement 4-edge snapping for move operations (was only 2-edge before)
- Add snap line visualization during all transform operations
- Fix movement reliability issues for circular trims

Snapping System:
- Always snap to UV space boundaries (0.0 and 1.0), even with unrestricted placement
- Display red snap lines when snapping to boundaries or other trim edges
- Check all 4 edges when moving (left, right, top, bottom)

Unrestricted Placement:
- New toggle in Trimsheet Settings to allow trims outside 0-1 UV space
- Clamping function respects setting during move operations
- Snapping to 0-1 boundaries remains functional regardless of setting
- Useful for tiling workflows and multi-UDIM setups

UI Improvements:
- Move "Add Trim" and "Add Circle" buttons above collapsible section
- Add new add_trim_circle.png icon
- Auto-expand trims list when adding first trim or switching to material with trims
- Auto-collapse when no trims exist
- Consistent with Stack Groups UI pattern

Bug Fixes:
- Fix UV sync mode support in auto-fit operator
- Fix ellipse data unpacking (4 values instead of 3)
- Fix radius scale operator for ellipse compatibility
- Update move operator cancel to restore ellipse data correctly

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
